titles.title: A bill to provide for the use of National Infantry Museum and Soldier Center Commemorative Coin surcharges, and for other purposes.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Dold asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 8/10/2012--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Amends the National Infantry Museum and Soldier Center Commemorative Coin Act to allow surcharges from the sale of a coin commemorating the legacy of the U.S. Army Infantry and the establishment of the National Infantry Museum and Soldier Center to be used for the retirement of debt associated with building such Museum and Center.
